title: Architects’ and Designers’ Papers

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of manuscripts, typescript papers, correspondence, printed papers, ephemera, photocopies, architectural reprographic prints, photographs, transparencies and negatives..

artist_display:
Thomas Chippendale (c.1709-1779)
William Ferguson Deknatel (1907-1973)
George Grant Elmslie (1871-1952)
Inigo Jones (1573-1652)
William Keck (1908-1995)
Philip B. Maher (1894-1981)
Pier Luigi Nervi (1891-1979)
Richard Neutra (1892-1970)
Richard Nickel (1928-1972)
Frederick Law Olmsted (1822-1903)
Irving K. Pond (1857-1939)
H.H. Richardson (1838-1886)
Christopher Wren (1632-1723)
description:
This collection of correspondence, lectures, and autobiographical documents from noted American and European architects and designers includes material from and relating to Thomas Chippendale, William Ferguson Deknatel, George Grant Elmslie, Inigo Jones, John Howells Mead, William Keck, Philip B. Maher, Pier Luigi Nervi, Richard Neutra, Richard Nickel, Frederick Law Olmsted, Irving K. Pond, Ralph Renwick, H.H. Richardson, and Christopher Wren. The collection is an aggregate of numerous small collections from various sources.

View finding aid.
View selected images from this collection.

Collection access:
Collections may be accessed in the Franke Reading Room of the Research Center at The Art Institute of Chicago, by appointment only. For further information, consult the FAQ.

Brownson, Robert Alan Bowlby, Catherine Bruck, Albert de Sauty, Barry Goldberg, Herb Greene, Wilbert Hasbrouck, Thomas Heinz, Elizabeth Wright Ingraham, David Jameson, the Family of Gertrude Lempp Kerbis (2018), Harold B. Schmidt, Seegers Family, Carl Sterner, Thomas Eddy Tallmadge, Mrs. Theodore Tieken, Dora Nothnagel Thomas, Thomas G. Yanul, the Erdmann Schmocker Estate, the National Trust for Historic Preservation, and other anonymous and private sources.
